meanings.definition: A cone-shaped utensil with a tube at the apex for conducting liquid or other substance through a small opening.
meanings.sent1: I used a funnel to pour the oil into the engine.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a funnel to pour the batter into the cupcake molds.
meanings.sent3: The funnel made the task of filling the tiny bottle much easier.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed through the hallway like a funnel amplifying sound.
meanings.sent5: The funnel's narrow tip ensured precise pouring of the liquid.

meanings.definition: To channel or guide in or as if in a funnel.
meanings.sent1: She tried to funnel all her energy into finishing the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The coach tried to funnel the team's enthusiasm towards winning the game.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to funnel his thoughts into a coherent argument.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to funnel all the audience's attention to his hands.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to funnel through the narrow canyon, creating a breathtaking sight.
